page.title: 08ATTITUDES
page.content: Society in this part of the Cotswolds is undergoing a rapid change. Many retired and well-to-do people have come to the district thus the price of housing and building land has soared. Young Campden people have been forced to leave the town thus a "them and us" situation has been created. The local people see this drain of their young people and the alteration of the whole way of life in the town as a disaster, but feel powerless and resentful when they see more speculative building taking place.Many shops in Campden which once provided a service to the people now are more touristy and the local person is obliged to shop in nearby towns. Campden Society,formed to look after the interests of the town but is largely non-Campdonian in membership. The local people see them as paternalistic and will not join.
